flawed_nl_solution:
Cheese pizzas are 1/3 of the pizza's purchased because 2 / (2+1) = 1/3
She buys 2 cheese pizzas because 6 x (1/3) = <<6*1/3=2>>2
These give her 36 pieces of cheese pizza because 2 x 18 = <<2*18=36>>36
The students at 28 pieces of cheese because 36 - 8 = <<36-8=28>>28
There are 14 students in her class because 28 / 2 = <<28/2=14>>14
#### 14

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 2/3, not 1/3. It appears there was an off-by-one error in the fraction.
